The activation code allow you to have the complete services of MA-Test, for instance, it gives you access to the information collected via online\n\nThe activation code distribution is limited to physicians and specialists who cooperate with CICESE.

The purpose of these Privacy Policies is to inform users about the use of their personal information to complete the application for registration at MA-Test. 

Note: We define personal information as the identifiable set of data, such as your name, address, e-mail address, and telephone number. 

A. USE OF INFORMATION. Personal information collected by consent of the user will be used as part of the patients' electronic file for the monitoring of the risk of falls. This information may be used for statistical purposes by the organisation responsible for this application; respecting at all times the identity of the users. 

B. DISCLOSURE OF INFORMATION. The organization responsible for this application will not market or lease personal information of users of the system. They do not take advantage of the individual information provided. Only statistical information can be disclosed to third parties. 

C. SECURITY. In some modules of the application, the information is treated and stored in coded format to shell personal information. 

D. MODIFICATIONS IN PRIVACY POLICIES. The organisation responsible for this application reserves the right to make changes to the Privacy Policies, in order to adapt to new legislative requirements, jurisprudence, technicians and any other reason that allows to provide a better service to users. The organisation responsible for this application undertakes to disclose the modifications through this medium. \ n
E. INTEGRITY. The Privacy Policies are an integral part of the Terms and Conditions of Use of the System. Consequently, the use of this application implies that users have read, understood and accepted the terms before being exposed. If the user does not agree with the Policies and/or the Terms of Use, the application can not be used.

Note: 0 represents that the patient did not follow indications, and 5 stars means that the patient followed indications precisely.
WARNING: Always stay near the Older Adult (OA) to prevent falls.
Describe and demonstrate the position. Tell the OA to stand on one foot. Take into account that the OA will assume such position for 10 s.

Describe and demonstrate the position of feet in semitandem. Tell the OA to place the instep of one foot so it is touching the big toe of the other foot. Take into account that the OA will assume such position for 10 s
Describe and demonstrate the tandem position. Tell the OA to place one foot in front of the other, heel touching toe. Take into account that the OA will assume such position for 10 s
Describe and demonstrate the position. Tell the OA to stand with his/her feet side by side. Take into account that the OA will assume such position for 10 s
Hold his/her arms and help him/her assume the correct foot position.
When the OA is steady, let go, but remain close to hold him/her in case he/she loses their balance.
Press START, the application makes a countdown: 3, 2, 1, accompanied by a sound start. Say \"Now\" when the count reaches zero to begin the test. After 10 seconds, the application chirps high.
IMPORTANT: If the patient can hold the position for 10 seconds without moving his/her feet or needing support, go on to the next position. If not, stop the test.
WARNING: Always stay near the Older Adult (OA) to prevent falls.

Tell the OA to sit in the middle of a chair without armrests, to place his/her hands on the opposite shoulder crossed at the wrists and to keep his/her arms against his/her chest, his/her feet flat on the floor and his/her back straight.
Press START, a countdown will begin. Say \"Go\" when the count reaches zero to begin the test.
WARNING: Always stay near the Older Adult (OA) to prevent falls.
The OA should use their regular footwear and can use a walking aid if needed. Begin by having the OA sit back in a chair without armrests and identify a line 7 meters away on the floor.
Press START, a countdown will begin. Say \"Go\" when the count reaches zero to begin the test.
Tell the OA to stand up from the chair.
Tell the OA to walk to the line marked on the floor at his normal pace.
Tell the OA to turn around.
Tell the OA to walk back to the chair at his normal pace.
Tell the OA to sit down again.
Stop the app after the OA has returned to sit down.
Instruct the OA that when he hears \"Now\", he should rise to a full standing position and then sit back down again.
Tell the OA that he/she should repeat this for 30 seconds as fast as possible.
The application makes a sound to indicate that the time is over.
IMPORTANT: If the patient must use his/her arms to stand, stop the test. Record zero for the number of repetitions and the score.
How to get an activation code?
Activation codes are assigned and distributed only to members and collaborator of the project.
What are the driving physical tests?

There will be three physical performance tests based on: Walk, Strength, and Balance.

In the Walking test the participants will be asked to get up from a chair, walk three meters, turn around, walk back to the chair and sit down again. During the test the older adults must use their regular footwear and use any assistance device that normally requires.

In the Strength test, the older adults will be asked to get up and sit on a chair repeatedly as fast as possible for 30 seconds.

In the Balance test the older adults will be asked to maintain four positions progressively: feet together, semi-tandem, tandem, and unipodal, for 10 seconds. The participants should not use any type of help (walking stick) and should keep their eyes open.

MA-Test is an application developed by CICESE.

In 2012, WHO reports that falls are the second world wide cause of death of the elderly population. The incidence of falls varies between countries, in average the 30-40 percent of the population of 65+ fall each year, but the rate increases as population age over 75+, where the incidence rises up to 45-50 percent.

In general, physical performance is a good indicator of risk in older adults. Thus, the goal of this application is to collect sensors data from a mobile device while patients perform a controlled physical test. Based on this data, we might construct algorithms to measure the risk of fall.
